The speaker emphasizes seatbelts and airbags in event 9 by discussing the three impacts in a collision and injury to internal organs. This is most directly established by the prior sub-events that provide explanations and visuals of the decelerator sled simulating vehicle crush to test occupant restraint systems in a controlled, repeatable way (events 1 and 3), the typical crash pulse with roughly 20-25 g acceleration shown and described (event 4), and the Head Injury Criterion (HIC) and related acceleration-duration considerations described and graphed (events 7-8). These events provide the physical basis for the speaker's emphasis on seatbelts and airbags as they relate to the forces involved in a collision and the potential injuries to internal organs.
